dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Audits a geodatabase for conformance with the GeMS schema. Output is written to several files, all in <Output_workspace>: <Input_geodatabase>-Validation.html, <Input_geodatabase>-ValidationErrors.html, <Input_geodatabase>-vFgdcMetadata.txt, and <Input_geodatabase>-vFgdcMetadataErrors.txt.

Checks include:

  • Schema errors:

  • Are required tables, feature datasets, and feature classes present?

  • In required and optional tables and feature classes, are required fields present?

  • In required and optional tables and feature classes, are required fields defined properly?

  • Schema extensions: are there tables, feature datasets, feature classes or fields that are not defined by the standard?

  • Is required content present?

  • Are _ID values unique?

  • Are all Source values defined in table DataSources?

  • Are there entries in DataSources which are unused elsewhere in the database?

  • Does table Glossary contain all required definitions?

  • Are there terms in table Glossary which are unused elsewhere in the database?

  • Are the definitions in GeoMaterialDict as prescribed by the GeMS standard?

  • What map units are present on the map, in DescriptionOfMapUnits, in CorrelationOfMapUnits, and cross sections? Do they all match?

  • Are there any extra units in DescriptionOfMapUnits?

  • Are HierarchyKey values in DescriptionOfMapUnits properly formatted?

  • Are there any pseudonulls (white-space values or empty strings), leading spaces, or trailing spaces in text fields?

Validate Database lists contents of tables DataSources, DescriptionOfMapUnits, Glossary, and (if present) MiscellaneousMapInformation. Validate Database also inventories the database and reports the names, datatypes, and number of rows for all tables, feature datasets, and feature classes. Note that using this script with a geodatabase with a schema that differs significantly from GeMS may not yield a useful report.

If ArcMap is open any joins, e.g., MapUnitPolys to DescriptionOfMapUnits, may need to be removed from the map composition. Also, if any map composition layer includes a definition query, the exclusion of some table rows may lead to incorrect results. Remove any definition queries or run the script from ArcCatalog!

If, when running this script from ArcMap, it fails to inventory some feature classes (or inventories a different database), try running it from ArcCatalog.

If MapUnitPolys, ContactsAndFaults, or a similar feature class in another feature dataset participates in a relationship class--e.g., feature-linked annotation--ArcGIS may crash when the script attempts to copy the feature class into the Validation gdb to check topology.

tool.name: ValidateDatabase

param.name: Input_geodatabase
param.dialogReference:
Can be a file geodatase (.gdb) or a personal geodatabase (.mdb).

.gdb or .mdb extension must be included.

param.name: Output_workspace
param.dialogReference: A directory that must exist and be writable. If no directory is specified, defaults to the directory that holds the input geodatabase.

param.name: Refresh_GeoMaterialDict
param.dialogReference:
Editing of the GeMS standard document resulted in minor changes to definitions of terms in GeoMaterialDict. These changes do not change the sense of the definitions. However, databases built with earlier versions of the GeMS toolbox will generate numerous errors associated with GeoMaterialDict and GeoMaterial values.

To avoid this, check the box (unchecked by default) to delete the GeoMaterialDict table in the database and replace it with the current version. The GeoMaterials domain (available as a picklist while editing the DescriptionOfMapUnits table) is also replaced with the current version.

This option permanently modifies the geodatabase. Perhaps you should back it up before using this option.

param.name: Skip_topology_checks
param.dialogReference:
Default is unchecked.

If checked, potentially time-consuming topology checks will be skipped and database will FAIL level 2 and level 3 compliance checks. This may be useful when testing for other aspects of compliance with the GeMS schema.

param.name: Delete_unused_Glossary_and_DataSources_rows
param.displayname: Delete unused Glossary and DataSources rows
param.dialogReference:
Many find it useful to copy an existing Glossary table into a new geodatabase. This commonly results in extraneous term definitions that may distract users.

Check this uption (unchecked by default) to automatically delete any rows in Glossary and DataSources that describe Terms and Sources that are unused elsewhere in the database.

  • Note that if deleted rows have missing required values these still show up as errors. Rerun the Validate Database script to clear such errors.

  • Deletion of a Glossary row may render a DataSource row unneeded. Rerun the Validate Database script to discover such errors.

This option permanently modifies the geodatabase. Perhaps you should back it up before using this option.

tool.summary:
Audits a geodatabase for conformance with the GeMS schema. Output is written to several files, all in <Output_workspace>: <Input_geodatabase>-Validation.html, <Input_geodatabase>-ValidationErrors.html, <Input_geodatabase>-vFgdcMetadata.txt, and <Input_geodatabase>-vFgdcMetadataErrors.txt.

  • Are there entries in DataSources which are unused elsewhere in the database?
